revised_title: Electron Diffraction in Halogens: A Comparative Study
tldr: This article presents a study on the diffraction of electrons in halogens, such as iodine and bromine, using a specialized apparatus. The results show similarities between the diffraction patterns of these halogens, which can be explained by the structure of their outer electron shells. The findings contribute to the understanding of atomic structure and electron scattering in different elements.
